info.name: Ed-Fi ODS/API Integration Test Suite Multiple Edorg types
info.description: Localhost integration testing using Postman Scripts

request.description:
This api post method adds new academicWeeks for particular school .
This test method will throw WeekIdentifier is required error when WeekIdentifier is not passed

item.name: Scenario 1 Create a StudentProgramAssociation  for a associated each EducationOrganization
Scenario 2 Update  a StudentProgramAssociation  for a associated each EducationOrganization
Scenario 3 Cannot Create a StudentProgramAssociation for a non-associated EducationOrganizationId value

exec: pm.test(`Error message of '${responseItem.message}' should match expected`, () => {

pm.expect(responseItem.message).to.equal("Authorization denied. No relationships have been established between the caller's education organization id claims (5001, 255901001) and one or more of the following properties of the resource item: 'EducationOrganizationId', 'StudentUniqueId'.");

item.name: Scenario 4  Create a DisciplineIncident (associated with the SchoolId)
Scenario 5  Create a CommunityProviderLicense (associated with the CommunityProviderId)
Scenario 6  Cannot Create a DisciplineIncident (associated with the different SchoolId)

exec: pm.test(`Error message of '${responseItem.message}' should match expected`, () => {

pm.expect(responseItem.message).to.equal("Authorization denied. No relationships have been established between the caller's education organization id claims (5001, 255901001) and the resource item's 'SchoolId' value.");

item.name: Scenario 7  Cannot Create a CommunityProviderLicense (associated with the different CommunityProviderId)

exec: pm.test(`Error message of '${responseItem.message}' should match expected`, () => {

pm.expect(responseItem.message).to.equal("Authorization denied. No relationships have been established between the caller's education organization id claims (5001, 255901001) and the resource item's 'CommunityProviderId' value.");

item.name: Scenario 8  Cannot Create a StudentProgramAssociation for either associated EdOrgId ( CommunityProviderId and PostSecondaryInstitutionId)

exec: pm.test(`Error message of '${responseItem.message}' should match expected`, () => {

pm.expect(responseItem.message).to.equal("Authorization denied. No relationships have been established between the caller's education organization id claims (51, 5001) and one or more of the following properties of the resource item: 'EducationOrganizationId', 'StudentUniqueId'.");

item.name: Scenario 9 GET request for StudentProgramAssociations should return all 3 records (SchoolId, a CommunityProviderId, and a PostSecondaryInstitutionId)

exec: pm.test("Should return the 2 items in response", () => {
pm.test("Should return the 2 ed org types with studentProgramAssociation Response ", () => {
pm.test("Should return only associated student (through the school) in studentProgramAssociation Response ", () => {

item.description:
Ensure that resources with EdOrg Id are accessible for each associated EdOrg type
Configure an API client with a SchoolId, a CommunityProviderId, and a PostSecondaryInstitutionId.

Create StudentProgramAssociations for each with an associated Student (through the School). (NOTE: Suggest creating a new School, Student and StudentSchoolAssociation for this scenario)

GET request for StudentProgramAssociations should return all 3 records just created.
GET request for StudentProgramAssociations should not return any pre-existing records for other EdOrgs.
Ensure that resources with concrete EdOrg Ids are accessible
GET request for StudentSchoolAssociations should return the associated Student.

item.name: Scenario 10  GET request to CommunityProviderLicenses should not generate an error

exec: pm.test("Should return some data for verification", () => {
pm.test("Should return only associated communityProvider in CommunityProviderLicenses Response ", () => {

item.description:
Configure an API client with a CommunityProviderId and PostSecondaryInstitutionId.

GET request to CommunityProviderLicenses should not generate an error.

item.name: Scenario 11  GET request to StudentDisciplineIncidentAssociations should return 200 with empty array even though there is no way the request could ever be authorized with the types of EdOrg claims
item.description:
Configure an API client with a CommunityProviderId and PostSecondaryInstitutionId.
GET request to StudentDisciplineIncidentAssociations should return 403 indicating there's no way to authorize the request (exact message TBD).
